@graph.name: EVD 6: Time to Result â€” MATSUlab Discourse Graph
@graph.description: Evidence bundle for the finding that among 50 experiments in the MATSUlab that produced formal results, the median time from issue claiming to first result was 12 days, with wide variance (n=50, IQR 0–50 days). Contains swimmer plot visualization, summary statistics with bootstrap CIs, and per-experiment timing data.

@graph.name: Evidence Bundle Metadata (JSON-LD)
@graph.description: Canonical evidence bundle metadata using the dge: (Discourse Graph Evidence) vocabulary.

@graph.name: Figure 6c: Experiment Lifecycle Swimmer Plot (linear scale)
@graph.description: Swimmer plot showing 50 experiment lifecycles from issue creation through claiming to result production. Each lane shows issue creation (grey circle), claim date (blue diamond), first result (red star), and subsequent results (light red circles). Sorted by time from issue creation to first result. Orange bars: self-claimed; purple bars: cross-person claiming.

@graph.name: Figure 6c: Experiment Lifecycle Swimmer Plot (log scale)
@graph.description: Log-scale version of the swimmer plot for resolving detail among experiments with short timelines (same-day to first-week results).

@graph.name: Figure 6c: Experiment Lifecycle Swimmer Plot (interactive)
@graph.description: Interactive Plotly version with hover tooltips showing experiment number, day values, and result counts.

@graph.name: Time-to-Result Summary Data
@graph.description: Summary statistics (mean, median, 95% bootstrap CIs, IQR, min, max) for three timing intervals (issue-to-claim, issue-to-result, claim-to-result), plus per-experiment anonymized timing records.
